definitions: physical features of a land area including elevation, vegetation, and obstacles
examples: The mountainous terrain made travel extremely difficult
Military strategists studied the terrain before planning the operation

definitions: small edible turtle that lives in fresh or brackish water
examples: The diamondback terrapin inhabits coastal salt marshes
Several terrapins basked on the log in the pond

definitions: small to medium-sized dog breeds originally bred for hunting vermin
examples: The Jack Russell terrier chased the ball energetically
Yorkshire terriers make excellent companion dogs despite their small size

definitions: administrative official responsible for a specific geographic area
member of a territorial military unit serving in home defense
examples: The territorial managed relations with indigenous communities
Several territorial officials attended the regional planning meeting
Territorial soldiers trained every weekend at the local base
The territorial units provided essential homeland defense

definitions: area of land under governmental or administrative control
area defended by an animal against others of the same species
sphere of action, thought, or knowledge that belongs to someone
examples: The northern territory experienced rapid population growth
Canada's Northwest Territories cover vast areas of wilderness
The wolf pack defended their territory against intruders
Male birds sing to establish territory during breeding season
Marketing strategy falls within her territory of expertise
This research ventures into unexplored intellectual territory

definitions: intense, overwhelming fear that paralyzes or overwhelms a person
person, especially a child, who causes trouble or annoyance
use of violence and intimidation to achieve political aims
examples: She felt terror when she heard footsteps in the dark
The survivors described their terror during the earthquake
That little terror broke three vases this morning
The neighborhood kids were absolute terrors on Halloween
The Reign of Terror followed the French Revolution
State terror was used to suppress political opposition

definitions: systematic use of violence and intimidation against civilians for political purposes
examples: International cooperation is essential to combat terrorism effectively
The terrorism threat level was raised after intelligence warnings

definitions: person who uses violence and intimidation against civilians for political aims
examples: Security forces arrested several suspected terrorists last night
The terrorist attack shocked the international community

definitions: absorbent cotton fabric with uncut loops forming a soft pile
examples: Terry cloth towels absorb water better than smooth fabrics
She wore a comfortable terry bathrobe after her shower

definitions: SI unit of magnetic flux density equal to one weber per square meter
electric vehicle and clean energy company founded by Elon Musk
examples: The MRI scanner operates at three tesla field strength
One tesla equals ten thousand gauss in magnetic measurement
Her new Tesla can drive over 400 miles per charge
Tesla revolutionized the electric vehicle market worldwide

definitions: arrangement of shapes that completely covers a surface without gaps or overlaps
examples: The bathroom floor featured a beautiful hexagonal tessellation
M.C. Escher created famous artistic tessellations with interlocking figures

definitions: theoretical geometric figure that is the four-dimensional analog of a cube
examples: The tesseract cannot be fully visualized in three-dimensional space
Science fiction often features tesseracts as portals between dimensions

definitions: procedure to measure knowledge, abilities, or performance
trial or experiment to determine quality or reliability
medical procedure to detect, diagnose, or monitor conditions
examples: Students prepared thoroughly for the final test
The driving test includes both written and practical components
The car underwent rigorous crash tests before approval
We need to test the new software for bugs
The blood test revealed elevated cholesterol levels
She scheduled a COVID test after experiencing symptoms

definitions: something that serves as evidence or proof of a quality
legal document declaring a person's wishes regarding property after death
major division of the Christian Bible
examples: Her success stands as testament to years of hard work
The building remains a testament to Victorian engineering
The lawyer read the last will and testament to the family
She updated her testament after her grandson was born
The Old Testament contains the Hebrew scriptures
Many Christians study both Old and New Testaments

definitions: person who has made a legally valid will before death
examples: The testator left his entire estate to charity
A testator must be of sound mind when creating a will

definitions: person who evaluates products or software for quality
device or instrument used to check or measure something
small sample of a product for customers to try
examples: The software tester found several critical bugs
Game testers play through levels looking for problems
Use this circuit tester to check the electrical connections
The battery tester showed the cells were still good
She tried the perfume tester before buying the bottle
Makeup testers are available at the cosmetics counter

definitions: either of two oval organs that produce sperm in males
examples: Testicular cancer screening involves regular self-examination of each testicle
The testicles produce both sperm and testosterone hormones

definitions: formal statement testifying to someone's character or qualifications
event or gift honoring someone's service or achievements
examples: Customer testimonials helped boost sales of the product
Her testimonial praised the doctor's exceptional care
The company organized a testimonial dinner for the retiring CEO
Players received testimonial matches after long careers

definitions: formal statement given under oath in a court of law
public declaration of religious experience or personal conviction
examples: The witness testimony proved crucial to the prosecution's case
She gave testimony about what she saw that night
His testimony about overcoming addiction inspired many listeners
The congregation listened to powerful testimonies of faith

definitions: systematic process of evaluating or assessing something for quality or performance
examples: Product testing ensures safety before market release
The testing phase revealed several software defects

definitions: primary male sex hormone responsible for reproductive tissues and secondary sexual characteristics
examples: Testosterone levels naturally decline with age in men
The doctor ordered testosterone replacement therapy for the patient

definitions: rope or chain used to tie an animal to a post
limit of one's resources, patience, or endurance
examples: The goat's tether allowed it to graze in a small area
She attached the boat's tether to the dock
He had reached the end of his tether with their behavior
Working two jobs pushed her to the end of her tether

definitions: small tropical freshwater fish popular in home aquariums
examples: Neon tetras school beautifully in the planted aquarium
She added cardinal tetras to her community fish tank

definitions: group or set of four related things or people
examples: The tetrad of elements formed a complete theoretical framework
During meiosis, chromosomes form tetrads before separation

definitions: three-dimensional shape with four triangular faces and four vertices
examples: A tetrahedron is the simplest form of polyhedron
The pyramid-shaped tetrahedron has six edges total

definitions: series of four related literary, dramatic, or musical works
examples: Wagner's Ring Cycle is a famous operatic tetralogy
The author completed her fantasy tetralogy after ten years

definitions: written or printed words forming the main body of a work
electronic message sent between mobile phones or devices
book used as a standard work for study
examples: The text of the speech was published online
She highlighted important text in the document
I'll text you when I arrive at the airport
He received several texts during the meeting
Students must purchase the required text for the course
The chemistry text costs over two hundred dollars

definitions: book used as a standard source of information for study
perfect or typical example of something
examples: The biology textbook contained detailed diagrams and exercises
Students complained about the high cost of textbooks
His response was a textbook example of crisis management
The operation was a textbook case of military precision

definitions: type of cloth or woven fabric used in manufacturing
examples: The textile industry employs millions of workers worldwide
Synthetic textiles have largely replaced natural fibers

definitions: act of sending written messages electronically between mobile devices
examples: Texting while driving is illegal in many jurisdictions
Teenagers spend hours texting their friends daily

definitions: feel and appearance of a surface or substance
the way different musical sounds combine in a piece
distinctive character or quality of something
examples: The cake had a light, fluffy texture
Rough texture of the bark scraped against her hand
The composer varied the texture from solo to full orchestra
Jazz musicians create rich texture through improvisation
The novel's texture comes from interwoven storylines
Urban texture changed dramatically with modern development

definitions: Scottish feudal lord or a warrior chief of a clan
examples: The thane swore loyalty to the Scottish king
Macbeth was Thane of Glamis before becoming king

definitions: expression of gratitude especially in prayer or worship
annual holiday celebrating harvest and blessings in North America
examples: The congregation offered thanksgiving for the year's blessings
Prayers of thanksgiving filled the morning service
Thanksgiving dinner brought the entire family together
They watched football after Thanksgiving turkey and pie

definitions: straw or similar material used as roofing on traditional buildings
examples: The cottage's thatch roof needed repairs after winter storms
Traditional thatch provides excellent insulation when properly maintained

definitions: person who builds or repairs roofs using straw or similar materials
examples: The thatcher carefully layered reed bundles on the cottage roof
Skilled thatchers are increasingly rare in modern times

definitions: process of ice or snow becoming liquid as temperature rises
improvement in relations between countries or people
examples: Spring thaw flooded the riverside properties
The sudden thaw made roads dangerously slippery
Diplomatic thaw between the nations led to renewed trade
A thaw in their relationship came after years of silence

definitions: process of causing or allowing something frozen to become liquid
examples: Thawing meat properly prevents bacterial growth
The thawing permafrost releases trapped greenhouse gases

definitions: building where plays and other dramatic performances are given
dramatic literature and performance as an art form
area where significant events or military operations occur
examples: The theater seats over two thousand patrons
They arrived at the theater early for good seats
She studied theater at the prestigious drama school
Modern theater explores challenging social themes
The Pacific theater was crucial during World War II
Surgeons work in the operating theater

definitions: building where plays and other dramatic performances are given
dramatic literature and performance as an art form
area where significant events or military operations occur
examples: The theatre reopened after extensive renovations
London's West End theatres attract millions annually
British theatre has a rich tradition spanning centuries
She pursued theatre studies at university
The Mediterranean theatre involved multiple Allied forces
Nurses prepared the operating theatre for surgery

definitions: professional presentation of a play or other dramatic performance
examples: The theatrical received mixed reviews from critics
Local theatricals provide entertainment throughout the summer

definitions: exaggerated, dramatic behavior or style intended to attract attention
examples: His theatricality made even simple stories entertaining
The lawyer's theatricality impressed the jury but annoyed the judge

definitions: act of stealing property that belongs to another person
examples: Identity theft affects millions of people annually
The theft occurred while the family was on vacation

definitions: belief in the existence of a god or gods, especially a creator
examples: Theism stands in contrast to atheism and agnosticism
Classical theism posits an omnipotent, omniscient deity

definitions: main subject or idea explored in a creative work
recurring melody or pattern in music or literature
unifying design or style applied to something
examples: The novel's theme explores redemption through suffering
Environmental themes dominate contemporary literature
The composer introduced the main theme in the first movement
Variations on the theme created musical complexity
They chose a tropical theme for the wedding reception
The restaurant's pirate theme delighted children

definitions: system of government where priests or religious leaders rule in the name of God
examples: Iran operates as a theocracy under Islamic law
Ancient Egypt functioned as a theocracy with divine pharaohs

definitions: person who studies or is an expert in theology and religious doctrine
examples: The theologian wrote extensively on biblical interpretation
Medieval theologians debated the nature of the Trinity

definitions: systematic study of the nature of God and religious belief
examples: She earned her doctorate in systematic theology
Liberation theology emerged from Latin American experiences

definitions: mathematical statement that has been proven based on previously established principles
examples: Pythagoras' theorem relates the sides of right triangles
The student struggled to prove the complex theorem

definitions: person who develops or studies theories rather than practical applications
examples: The theoretician proposed a new model of particle interaction
Political theoreticians influenced revolutionary movements

definitions: person who forms or studies theories about a particular subject
examples: Conspiracy theorists spread misinformation on social media
The music theorist analyzed Bach's compositional techniques
